intro.description:
This cheat sheet will demonstrate how to create and run an RCP application using PDE.
To learn more about using cheat sheets, click the help button in the top right corner (?).

item.title: Open the plug-in development perspective
item.description:
To open the plug-in development perspective, select Window->Open Perspective->Other... and choose Plug-in Development.
Alternatively, click the following button to perform the task.

item.title: Create the plug-in
item.description: To create the plug-in, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select "File->New->Project..." from the main menu and choose "Plug-in Project" from the resulting "New Project" dialog box
Input "com.example.rcpapp" into the "Project Name" text box on the "Plug-in Project" page and click "Next >"
Select the "Yes" radio button under the "Rich Client Application" heading on the "Plug-in Content" page and click "Next >"
Select the "Hello RCP" template from the list of "Available Templates" and click "Finish"

item.title: Run the RCP Application
item.description: To run the RCP application, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select the "com.example.rcpapp" plug-in editor from the workbench and select the "Overview" tab within it
Click the "Launch an Eclipse application" hyperlink under the "Testing" heading
Verify that you see an empty window with a window title of "Hello RCP"

item.title: Modify the plug-in source
item.description:
In this step, we want to suppress the Hello RCP text in the window title bar of our RCP application.
To modify the plug-in source accordingly, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Open "ApplicationWorkbenchWindowAdvisor.java" by locating it in the "src" folder of the "com.example.rcpapp" package in the "Package Explorer" view and double-clicking it
Comment out 'configurer.setTitle("Hello RCP");' in the "preWindowOpen()" method

item.title: Test the RCP Application
item.description: To test the RCP application, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select the "com.example.rcpapp" plug-in editor from the workbench and select the "Overview" tab within it
Click the "Launch an Eclipse application" hyperlink under the "Testing" heading
Verify that you see an empty window with no window title
